system.description:
This spell grants the caster great mobility, including aerial flight, planar travel, and the ability to become gaseous. It lasts for one turn per caster level.

Flight:

  • The caster can fly as per the Fly spell, at a speed of 360' (120').

Planar Travel:

  • The caster can enter a nearby plane of existence by concentrating for one round.
  • A maximum of one plane per turn can be traversed.
  • The caster may bring one additional creature per five levels (rounded down).
  • To bring others, they must be touching the caster at the moment of transition.
  • Unwilling creatures may make a saving throw vs. spells to resist the effect.
  • The caster cannot send others while remaining behindâ€”he must accompany them.

Gaseous Form:

  • The caster may assume gaseous form by concentrating for one full round.
  • If interrupted, no transformation occurs.
  • Unlike the potion of gaseous form, all carried equipment transforms as well.
  • In gaseous form, the caster moves at double flight speed (720' / 240').
  • The caster cannot use items or cast spells while gaseous.
  • Only magical attacks (weapons or spells) can harm the caster in gaseous form.
  • The caster cannot pass through a Protection from Evil effect or an Anti-Magic Shell.
